newsitem.title: ISRAEL: France's Chirac arrives in Israel.
newsitem.headline: France's Chirac arrives in Israel.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac arrived in Israel from Damascus on Monday for a visit marred in advance by bickering with the Jewish state, an Israeli foreign ministry official said.
Chirac was met at Tel Aviv airport by Israeli Foreign Minister David Levy, the official said.
Chirac, given a hero's reception during a two-day visit to Syria, kicks off the Israel leg of a regional tour on Monday following a last-minute resolution of a string of diplomatic disputes.

In Damascus, Chirac had demanded Europe join Washington as a co-sponsor of Arab-Israeli negotiations. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was quick to say it was not a wise idea. Chirac eased his stance but still said Europe had a right to be engaged in Middle East peace moves.
A tiff had emerged over the French president's plans to speak to Palestinian legislators while shunning Israel's parliament. French officials belatedly added a visit to the Israeli parliament.

Chirac had intended to send Foreign Minister Herve de Charette to PLO headquarters in Jerusalem. After Israel objected, Chirac decided not to take de Charette to Israel at all. A junior health minister will instead visit the headquarters at Orient House in a move Israel grudgingly accepted.
